Subjective: Bilateral eye irritation, started Tuesday AM on waking. Initially one eye, now both affected. Sensation of foreign body (dust/hair). Associated redness and mild swelling ('thicker'). Eyes slightly stuck in the morning. Pain only on forceful squeezing of eyelids. No vision changes, no photophobia, no significant pain, no purulent discharge. No trauma, no new cosmetics/creams. No contact lens use. Systemically well, no fever or flu symptoms. Social: Working mother, partner currently away. Concern: Worried about contagion to daughter and if it's something more serious. Request: Confirmation of diagnosis and advice on treatment (e.g., drops/antibiotics).
Objective: Eyes: Bilateral conjunctival injection (redness). No foreign body visualized on lower or upper lid eversion. Lashes appear normal. Pupils equal and reactive to light.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis. No signs of bacterial superinfection.
Plan: Reassurance: Explained as likely viral inflammation, expected to be self-limiting.
Advice: Avoid rubbing eyes. Cleanse with lukewarm tap water if lids are stuck in AM.
Medication: May use OTC artificial tears for symptomatic relief/soothing.
Safety Netting: Return immediately for increased pain, significant pus-like discharge, or any change in vision.
Follow-up: Return in 2 weeks if symptoms have not resolved.
